beginner.title: Beginner Grammar
beginner.description: Basic grammar rules and sentence structure

lessons.title: Present Simple Tense
lessons.explanation: The present simple tense is used for habits, routines, and general facts. Form: Subject + base verb (+ s/es for he/she/it)

questions.question: Choose the correct sentence:
options: He go to work by bus.
He goes to work by bus.
He going to work by bus.

lessons.title: Articles (a, an, the)
lessons.explanation: Articles are used before nouns. 'A' and 'an' are indefinite articles. 'The' is the definite article.

questions.question: _____ book on the table is mine.

intermediate.title: Intermediate Grammar
intermediate.description: More complex grammar structures and tenses

lessons.title: Present Perfect Tense
lessons.explanation: The present perfect tense connects past actions to the present. Form: have/has + past participle
examples: I have lived here for five years.
They have never been to Paris.

advanced.title: Advanced Grammar
advanced.description: Complex grammar structures and advanced usage

lessons.title: Subjunctive Mood
lessons.explanation: The subjunctive mood expresses hypothetical or non-real situations, wishes, and suggestions.
examples: If I were you, I would study harder.
I suggest that he be more careful.
It's important that she arrive on time.

questions.question: If I _____ (be) rich, I would travel the world.
Explain the difference between 'If I was' and 'If I were' and provide examples.
